item.title: COLA
item.description: Constant Overlap-Add Constraint To ensure successful reconstruction of nonmodified spectra, the analysis window must satisfy the COLA constraint. In general, if the analysis window satisfies the condition $\displaystyle \sum_{m=-\infty}^\infty g^{a+1}(n-mR)=c,\;^\forall n\in\mathbb{Z}$, the window is considered to be COLA-compliant. Perfect Reconstruction In general, computing the STFT of an input signal and inverting it does not result in perfect reconstruction.
